summary: A resource guide to special screen-archery
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://s6.postimg.org/mbcjg6w9d/Staging_Main.png[/img][/center]
[color=#ffd966][size=5]Staging in Skyrim[/size][/color]

This is a guide to help those who would like to explore some unconventional ways when taking screen-shots, also known as screen-archery.

This is brought to you unpretentiously, except maybe to share some craziness and fun.


[color=#ffd966][size=4][u]How is this presented?[/u][/size][/color]
In the download section you will find a small PDF document with an overview of the basics that are required in screen-archery; it covers the following topics:
[list]
[*]Console commands
[*]Suggested mods
[*]Posing and animation addons
[/list]
To go along with this guide, you will find below three videos to help your initiation or exploration in the wonderful hobby of screen-archery. 

And finally, I will link few sets made by you.

[color=#ffd966][size=4][u]Jaxonz Positioner
[/u][/size][/color]By Jaxonz, [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52583/?]link[/url].
This tool is the center-piece of the guide. There is a whole video dedicated to it, you will be surprised how powerful it is, and yet easy to use, opening so many possibilities that your imagination will be in a high state of excitement, you are warned! :)

[u]What to expect and not to expect[/u]
Since I am not a modder I will not be able to help you on "bugs" with the presented mods in the guide, you will need to refer to the sites that are offering the tools. I took some precaution to propose you only renown  and stable tools, still, some cautions will be required from you, especially to never use your regular saved game files when doing some extreme staging, Jaxonz Positioner is a very powerful tool, and with power comes responsibilities.  

But feel free to ask questions about staging, share new tricks or simply send some crazy images of your own. It's mainly all about being crazy, in the good way, so simply have fun and I hope I could help a few achieve that.

I would like to thank warmly [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/users/15479034/?]Raccondance[/url] who helped me in the redaction of the guide, which is still a work in progress. If you visit his gallery, you'll discover a highly talented fellow...with some very special skills in craziness :)

And to Jaxonz, just a huge hug to have provided the community this wonderful tool that is the Positioner. Someone wrote to me this morning that it is like a portable CK ;)
